source.author: Conn, B.J.
source.title: Buddlejaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Conn, B.J. (1999). Buddlejaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Inflorescence a globose head; flowers orange
Inflorescence paniculate; flowers white to purple, greenish, yellow or orange
Corolla tube short, up to 1.3 times as long as the lobes; stamens well exserted
Corolla tube at least twice as long as lobes; stamens included (or sometimes just exserted)
Leaves with petiole 15–25 mm long; flowers yellow to orange; anthers inserted just below corolla mouth, just included; fruit a berry

Leaves with petiole 2–5 mm long; flowers white or violet to lilac or less often purple, with orange-yellow throat; anthers inserted at or below the middle of the corolla tube, included; fruit a capsule
